We faced a brutal dilemma. Two massive technologies dropped simultaneously: #Clowdbot and #MCP Apps. Both are incredible. But as a small team, we canâ€™t chase everything. We had to place a bet. This is the new reality of Engineering in 2026. The job has shifted from "Feature Development" to "High-Velocity Research." You can't just code anymore. You have to constantly ask: Is this noise, or is it leverage? We broke it down: Clowdbot - Amazing consumer personal agent. MCP Apps - The fix for broken AI interfaces. We realized the second one is the silent killer of AI Assistant right now. Connectivity is solved, but the Tool Output layer is failing us: - The UI Trap: You are shackled to the markdown limits of Claude/GPT. - The Cost: Massive text dumps burn tokens and cause context rot. - The Fragmentation: There is no standard way to render the same app across different models. MCP Apps change the game. It replace the "Wall of Text" with rich, interactive interfaces. Instead of burning tokens on raw data dumps, you get clean Dashboards, Forms, and Visualizations. Result: No more context rot. Just usable tools. So we made the hard call. We ignored the Clowdbot hype and sprinted on #MCP Apps. We extended Apigeneâ€™s Gateway with a single mission: To turn any tool (API or MCP) into an interactive MCP App instantly. But research requires proof. To know if this was real, we didn't just build a prototype. We built 50 different apps. The result isn't just "widgets." It is a personalized control center running directly inside #Claude and #ChatGPT . The Lesson: In this era, The hard part isn't building the tech it's ignoring the AI FOMO. Can you share some details about the challenges and the limitations you faced ? my personal (limited) experience so far was that the ui capabilities are a little restrained in Claude desktop for example. Would love to hear more.","num_reactions":0}],"user_followers":6907,"user_posts":200,"user_articles":4,"post_type":"post","account_type":"Person","post_text_html":"Two weeks ago, the AI FOMO hit us hard.

We faced a brutal dilemma. Two massive technologies dropped simultaneously: #Clowdbot and #MCP Apps.

Both are incredible. But as a small team, we canâ€™t chase everything. We had to place a bet.

This is the new reality of Engineering in 2026. The job has shifted from "Feature Development" to "High-Velocity Research." You can't just code anymore. You have to constantly ask: Is this noise, or is it leverage?

We broke it down:
Clowdbot - Amazing consumer personal agent.
MCP Apps - The fix for broken AI interfaces.

We realized the second one is the silent killer of AI Assistant right now. Connectivity is solved, but the Tool Output layer is failing us:
- The UI Trap: You are shackled to the markdown limits of Claude/GPT.
- The Cost: Massive text dumps burn tokens and cause context rot.
- The Fragmentation: There is no standard way to render the same app across different models.

MCP Apps change the game. It replace the "Wall of Text" with rich, interactive interfaces. Instead of burning tokens on raw data dumps, you get clean Dashboards, Forms, and Visualizations.

Result: No more context rot. Just usable tools.

So we made the hard call. We ignored the Clowdbot hype and sprinted on #MCP Apps.

We extended Apigeneâ€™s Gateway with a single mission: To turn any tool (API or MCP) into an interactive MCP App instantly.

But research requires proof. To know if this was real, we didn't just build a prototype. We built 50 different apps.

The result isn't just "widgets." It is a personalized control center running directly inside #Claude and #ChatGPT.

The Lesson: In this era, The hard part isn't building the tech it's ignoring the AI FOMO. Success is having the guts to let "revolutionary" hype pass so you can focus your deep research on what actually matters..
